\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 102968}

\subsection*{Woke Up in Intensive Care}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{beff}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 2 hits & buccal & 25I-NBOMe & blotter / tab\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 118.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I'd taken 25i about 3 times before last friday, and I was doing it with friends. I took two tabs at once and my tongue felt numb, I sat in the corner of my friends room repeating `I'm scared I don't like this.' over and over until my friend gave me a sip of vodka and a few tokes on a joint to calm me down. I then was laughing with them, tripping my face off having a good time until I heard someone say, we should call an ambulance.



I woke up the next say in intensive care.



Apparently I had overdosed on 25I and had a seizure, I was unable to breathe so they phoned an ambulance, I had been put in a medical coma and was on a life support machine.



Safe to say I will not be doing 25i again.

\end{document}
